# Air Charter Services in Nunavut - Parks Canada

## Solicitation Information

* Solicitation Number: 5P420-23-0016/A
* Publication Date: 2023-09-20
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-10-20T16:00:00
* Amendment Number: 5
* Amendment Date: 2023-10-20

## Procurement Details

The Parks Canada Agency is seeking the provision of fixed wing air charter services on an as-and-when-required basis for carrying personnel, materials, and equipment to Nunavut communities for operational purposes. The services are required for a period of approximately two (2) years, with an option to extend for an additional one (1) year period.

## Contractor Requirements

The contractor must be capable of providing two (2) aircraft capable of landing on gravel runways. The first aircraft must be able to transport up to twelve (12) passengers, while the second aircraft must be able to transport up to eight (8) passengers.

## Evaluation Criteria

The bids will be evaluated based on several criteria, including:

* Technical capability to meet the requirements of the solicitation
* Inuit Benefits Plan (IBP), which includes elements such as Inuit employment, training, and ownership
* Price

## Instructions for Submissions

Bidders are required to submit their bids in either English or French. The bids must be submitted by fax or email to the designated email address soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca. The bids must be in PDF format, with a maximum file size of 15 MB. Additionally, the bids must be labeled with the solicitation number, project name, and instruction on how many emails are included (e.g. 1 of 2).

## Important Notes

* Parks Canada is not accepting bids via SAP Ariba.
* Bids received in person or by courier will not be accepted.
* The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is soumissionsouest-bidswest@canada.ca.
* The only acceptable facsimile for responses to bid solicitations is 1-866-246-6893.

## Access to Information

Documents related to this solicitation can be accessed through the Government of Canada's tendering service at www.canadabuys.canada.ca. Bidders are responsible for ensuring that they obtain the most up-to-date information. Late submissions will not be considered. The Crown retains the right to negotiate
